choices.D: A table with a materialized view

questions.question_text: Which Snowflake table is an implicit object layered on a stage, where the stage can be either internal or external?

comments.content: Execution time provides information about “where the time was spent” during the processing of a query

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-query-profile
Operator Nodes by Execution Time
A collapsible panel in the operator tree pane lists nodes by execution time in descending order, enabling users to quickly locate the costliest operator nodes in terms of execution time. The panel lists all nodes that lasted for 1% or longer of the total execution time of the query (or the execution time for the displayed query step, if the query was executed in multiple processing steps).

Execution Time
Provides information about which processing tasks consumed query time (described in Query/Operator Details below). Additionally, for step-level information, it shows the state of the given step, and its execution time.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
answer is C

C:
Materialized views are automatically and transparently maintained by Snowflake. A background service updates the materialized view after changes are made to the base table. This is more efficient and less error-prone than manually maintaining the equivalent of a materialized view at the application level.
Materialized views are designed to improve query performance for workloads composed of common, repeated query patterns. However, materializing intermediate results incurs additional costs. As such, before creating any materialized views, you should consider whether the costs are offset by the savings from re-using these results frequently enough.

Selected Answer: C
materialized view is automatically refreshed by a Snowflake managed warehouse.

choices.B: An additional set of scripts is needed to refresh data in materialized views.
choices.C: A materialized view is automatically refreshed by a Snowflake managed warehouse.
choices.A: Materialized views cannot be refreshed automatically.
choices.D: A materialized view can be set up with the auto-refresh feature using the SQL SET command.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of the maintenance of a materialized view?
Which command should be used to implement a masking policy that was already created in Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
ALTER MASKING POLICY

ENTERPRISE EDITION FEATURE

This feature requires Enterprise Edition (or higher). To inquire about upgrading, please contact Snowflake Support.
Replaces the existing masking policy rules with new rules or a new comment and allows the renaming of a masking policy.

Any changes made to the policy rules go into effect when the next SQL query that uses the masking policy runs.

See also:
Masking policy DDL

Syntax

ALTER MASKING POLICY [ IF EXISTS ] <name> RENAME TO <new_name>

ALTER MASKING POLICY [ IF EXISTS ] <name> SET BODY -> <expression_on_arg_name_to_mask>

ALTER MASKING POLICY [ IF EXISTS ] <name> SET TAG <tag_name> = '<tag_value>' [ , <tag_name> = '<tag_value>' ... ]

ALTER MASKING POLICY [ IF EXISTS ] <name> UNSET TAG <tag_name> [ , <tag_name> ... ]

Selected Answer: D
D. modify column SET MASKING POLICY. APPLY MASKING is privilege that should grant to role to apply the masking policy

comments.content: Ans is A - n this example, my_masking_policy is the name of the masking policy that was previously created. The SET BODY clause defines the logic for the masking policy, specifying which roles can view the actual data and which roles will see masked data.
D is correct, APPLY is privilege that should to grant to role

choices.D: Querying a materialized view is slower than executing a query against the base table of the view.
choices.B: Data accessed through materialized views can be stale.
choices.A: A materialized view can query only a single table.
choices.C: Materialized view refreshes need to be maintained by the user.

questions.question_text: Which statement accurately describes a characteristic of a materialized view?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A- Can query only a single table
No join, no multiple tables, no aggregations , auto-refreshed

Selected Answer: A
Can query only a single table
A is correct answer. The materialized view is maintained by SF in Enterprise version and above and it can refer to only one table.
Obviously A is a correct answer， but also B seems to be correct as far as I can see．

A
There is no join in materialized view. Hence Single queries.
